data.title: dependency problems prevent configuration of openra
data.body:
Hello.
This is my OS details:

**Distributor ID:   Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
Release:    16.04
Codename:   xenial**

I got this problem

> Unpacking openra (20160508.release) ...
> dpkg: dependency problems prevent configuration of openra:
>  openra depends on mono-runtime (>= 2.10); however:
>   Package mono-runtime is not installed.
>  openra depends on libmono-system-core4.0-cil; however:
>   Package libmono-system-core4.0-cil is not installed.

>   Package libmono-system-drawing4.0-cil is not installed.
>  openra depends on libmono-system-data4.0-cil; however:
>   Package libmono-system-data4.0-cil is not installed.
>  openra depends on libmono-system-numerics4.0-cil; however:
>   Package libmono-system-numerics4.0-cil is not installed.
>  openra depends on libmono-system-runtime-serialization4.0-cil; however:
>   Package libmono-system-runtime-serialization4.0-cil is not installed.
>  openra depends on libmono-system-xml-linq4.0-cil; however:
>   Package libmono-system-xml-linq4.0-cil is not installed.
>  openra depends on libsdl2 | libsdl2-2.0-0; however:
>   Package libsdl2 is not installed.
>   Package libsdl2-2.0-0 is not installed.
> 
> dpkg: error processing package openra (--install):
>  dependency problems - leaving unconfigured

data.body:

Might be a prereq for maps defining custom tileset additions even?

path allows further development to run OpenRA on Raspbian.

It compiles without errors. It does not start though.

data.title: [TS] GDI Component Tower bug.
data.body:
When GDI component tower is placed and being fired upon during Make Animation, it skips the make animation and locks up. You can't sell it, you can't have a turret on it, in other words it becomes a useless drain of power until destroyed.
I noticed it's related to WithWallSpriteBody: trait and as long as it's present the problem persists.

data.title: Remove redundant Effects
data.body:
`SpriteEffect` can (now) do everything that `Explosion`, `Corpse` and `Smoke` could do, so I scrapped those three to get rid of some redundancy and duplication.

Additionally, the only thing in `Game` that used `SpriteEffect` was the `WorldInteractionControllerWidget`, which itself is not required by anything in `Game`, so I moved both up to `Mods.Common`.

data.title: Fix the bogus getAirstrikeTarget methods of the nod08 missions
data.body:
They always searched 6 times even after finding a target.
Now they also account for SAM sites (like in the previous missions).

And yes, you can indeed get SAM sites in those missions, it isn't too easy though and thus I'd like the player to be rewarded for getting them.

I'm trying to get the Dedicated Server running on Windows 7 x64, but running directling in a crash:

e Server.DedicatedLoop=True Server.Name="KPO3 Dedicated Server" Server.ListenPor

data.title: Skirmish battles crash after 30-45 minutes of gameplay

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
(follow up on #11333)

Good evening OpenRA developers,

As per obrakmann's request, I am submitting a new bug report with additional information about this problem.

To reiterate, when playing a skirmish battle in Dune 2000, the game crashes to desktop after about 30-45 minutes of gameplay.  

As it turns out, the game does not write any information to exception.log when this occurs.  Rather, the crash seems to be due to a .NET error, as two Application error logs are written into the Event Viewer after the crash occurs.

This instance of the crash occurred on a desktop computer running Windows XP Professional x64 with a GeForce GTX 280 (Driver Version 6.14.13.681, Driver Date 9/23/2012), but I have also encountered this same problem on a laptop computer running Windows 7 Professional x64 with a GeForce 9800M GTS (Driver Version 9.18.13.623, Driver Date 8/30/2012).

I have attached screenshots of the battle setup I used for this particular battle and the .NET Application errors I found in my Event Viewer.

Once again, thank you in advance for any help you can provide!
![openra d2k game setup](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19510851/15457675/8f18a784-205b-11e6-9b6c-b65e790811e6.PNG)
![event viewer error 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19510851/15457673/8f16bbf4-205b-11e6-931f-f51c817b4f33.PNG)
![event viewer error 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19510851/15457674/8f170690-205b-11e6-88b0-dd15e2bd5d9c.PNG)

data.title: OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --extract does not work as described on linux
data.body:
OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --extract does not work as described here: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Game-Content on a debian GNU/linux system. Steps to reproduce:
1. put MAIN.MIX from "Red Alert Allied" CD into folder $Home/.openra/Content/ra
2. open terminal and do:

```
cd /usr/share/games/openra
mono --debug ./OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --extract movies1.mix
```

Expected result: file movies1.mix in folder /usr/share/games/openra.

Actual result: The following error message

```
Error: Utility application crashed. See utility.log for details

Unhandled Exception:
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: File not found: movies1.mix
File name: 'movies1.mix'
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Open (System.String filename) <0x41312470 + 0x000af> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.ExtractFilesCommand.Run (OpenRA.ModData modData, System.String[] args) <0x413373f0 + 0x0009d> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x412d4040 + 0x005f0> in <filename unknown>:0 
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.IO.FileNotFoundException: File not found: movies1.mix
File name: 'movies1.mix'
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Open (System.String filename) <0x41312470 + 0x000af> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.ExtractFilesCommand.Run (OpenRA.ModData modData, System.String[] args) <0x413373f0 + 0x0009d> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x412d4040 + 0x005f0> in <filename unknown>:0 
```

In fact, when in the same folder as MAIN.MIX and typing

```
mono /usr/share/games/openra/OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --extract MAIN.MIX
```

it says

```
MAIN.MIX saved.
```

but nothing else happens.

Am I missing something concerning usage of the utility? Is there a technical reason not to just have the program take two arguments, namely file name of the archive (MAIN.MIX) and file name of the desired file to extract?

data.title: Mod Chooser freezes on Quit
data.body:
When in Pseudo-fullscreen mode, the Mod Chooser freezes on pressing the Quit button. The freeze does not happen in Windowed mode.

**To reproduce:**
1. Start OpenRA with any mod selected.
2. Ensure that the game runs in Pseudo-fullscreen mode.
3. Click Mods.
4. In the Mod Chooser, click Quit.

**What happens?**

The application freezes. The Mod Chooser remains visible, but it does not react to any further mouse clicks or key presses.

**What I expected to happen?**

The application terminates.

**Relevant Information**

No exception is thrown and `exception.log` is not created.

Last 5 lines of `debug.log`: 

```
Could not find collection 'dialog'
Could not find collection 'dialog'
Could not find collection 'dialog'
Could not find collection 'dialog'
Could not find collection 'dialog'
```

**Version Info**

OpenRA release-20160508, Mono JIT compiler version 4.4.0, on Linux 4.5.4-1-ARCH

Name="${Name:-"Dedicated Server"}"

ListenPort="${ListenPort:-"5354"}"
ExternalPort="${ExternalPort:-"5354"}"

while true; do
     mono --debug OpenRA.Server.exe Game.Mod=$Mod \

     Server.AdvertiseOnline=$AdvertiseOnline Server.AllowPortForward=$AllowPortForward
done

data.title: Potential NullReferenceException in DrawLineToTarget
data.body:
As mentioned in #11276, it looks like `DrawLineToTarget` can cause an NRE, presumably if the targeted actor dies the same tick it was clicked on.

Anyway, here's the full exception:
https://gist.github.com/reaperrr/73df73fd7bc1c1f9123ab6f1999c222e

data.title: [RA] Buff mig and longbow AG weapons
data.body:
So from [various](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19498&start=75&postdays=0&postorder=asc&highlight=) RA balance [threads](#10437) there seems to be a consensus that the MiG and Longbow could do with some buffs. This PR does NOT introduce mig AA weaponry. I think @SoScared made [some very good points](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10437#issuecomment-171100185) about the possible balance affects of giving Migs AA.

I am instead suggesting to balance these units by fixing some of the issues I have discovered through testing, which in turn should give them a better defined role in the game. With these changes, they should be pretty good investments for sniping mobile armour while matching their cheaper counterparts vs buildings.

**Issue 1.** In the current release the longbow anti ground missile has one cell less range than the hind chaingun. Now both are equal. 

**Issue 2.** Missiles for both the MiG and the longbow would explode just after their max range. This made damaging moving targets nearly impossible without somewhat fiddly micro. This has now been fixed. Rangers are the only land unit fast enough to evade rockets fairly reliably while APCs can travel the furthest before being hit.

**Issue 3.** A single hind and yak in the current release does more damage to _nearly every building in the game_ compared to a single Mig or LB. Now Migs and LBs do slightly more damage overall to most buildings compared to their cheaper counterparts and twice the damage to concrete walls as before.

**Balance 1.** The longbow now fires in a volley of 4 rockets instead of 2, buts its cool-down between volleys has been increased by 40%. This is still an overall buff and makes the LB more useful for hit and run. This will hopefully make Allied late game a little more interesting.

data.title: Fix mpspawn ownership
data.body: Fixes #11333.

data.title: Spies Can Be Seen
data.body: I'm playing the latest stable release 20160508 and apparently spies can be seen. I sent some over to my enemy's base and he said he could see them, they looked like spies-- not like his own units, and his base defenses killed them. Apparently they were cheap, low-budget spies. Beware imitations!

data.title: Fixed various offsets in TS
data.body: And enabled muzzle flash on Titan.

data.title: System.IndexOutOfRangeException in Dune 2000
data.body:
Good evening OpenRA developers!

When playing Dune 2000, the game often crashes, usually when in combat with enemy units.  Here is the exception.log from the most recent crash:

Dune 2000 Mod at Version release-20160508
on map b9c74c6501ba964e2eaf0eddc617b7734b126cda (The Duell by CombineCnR).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 5.2.3790 Service Pack 2)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.1022
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.MPStartLocations.<WorldLoaded>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0(Client c)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectListIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.MPStartLocations.WorldLoaded(World world, WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.World.LoadComplete(WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type)
   at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder(OrderManager orderManager, World world, Int32 clientId, Order order)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

I'm not sure exactly how to reproduce the crash, but each time it has happened, my units have been in combat with enemy units.  The game freezes, the sound loops for several seconds, and then I receive the warning that the game has crashed.

The issue is intermittent, and apart from it, the game runs well.  Any help you guys can offer would be greatly appreciated!

data.body:
Blue horizontal lines appear in Spec / Replay modes when zooming out (0,5x or 0,25x)

data.title: FireDelay and animation
data.body:
In RA, despite the grenadier having a value for `FireDelay`, the start of the firing animation begins when the projectile is launched. This makes the grenadier throwing animation play a noticeable amount of frames after the projectile is already in the air. 

Also, moving immediately after the attack command is given the unit can be in a different position to where the weapon spawns. This is more noticeable as the value is increased.

On bleed.
